bibl.title: Biographical notes on Jesse W. Lazear, [1926]

div1.p: These notes concern the life of Lazear.

div1.head: Biographical notes on Jesse W. Lazear, [1926]
div1.p:
Married: 1896 to Miss Houston whom he met while studying in Europe
Married in San Francisco, California.
Children: William Houston Lazear and Margaret Lazear Briggs

Father: William L. Lazear married Charlotte Clayland Pettigrew
Was merchant in Baltimore; died when Dr. Lazear was eleven.

Grandfather: Jesse Lazear married Francis Burbridge; was banker
and for two terms member of Congress.

Origin: The Lazear family were French Huguenots and came from
France in 1730 - settled in Maryland.

Maternal Ancestors: of Dr. Jesse W. Lazear:
Lewellyn Lechmere Wall, son of Lady Lechmere and Sir
William Wall, came to America from England and landed
at Charleston, 1765.

Education: Dr. Jesse William Lazeal prepared for College at
Trinity Hall and Washington & Jefferson University in
Pennsylvania.

In 1889 graduated from Johns Hopkins University
" 1892 " " Columbia Medical College
" 1893 studied at University of Edinburgh; received
honors for work in anatomy
1892-94 House Physician Bellevue Hospital, New York
1896 Studied at Pasteur Institute - Paris
1895 " " University of Berlin
1896 Resident Physician at Johns Hopkins Hospital

First doctor to take charge of clinical laboratory at
Johns Hopkins

First with Dr. Thayer & Dr. Wolley to partly confirm
the work of Ross and the Italians in the mosquito
cycle of malarial parasites.

Pathology of Malarial Fever Structure of the Parasites
& Changes in Tissue.

Wrote sections on Diphtheria, plague, yeallow fever,
cerebro-spinal meningitis for Progressive Medicine.

First in this country to confirm and elaborate the
studies of Romanowsky concerning the hematozoa of malaria
Palliology of Malarial fevers - Structure Parasites and
Change Tissue (Journal of American Medical Association,
Vol.35, N° 15).
